member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfFocus
member.summary: PDF Focus .Net is designed to convert PDF documents to All formats.

remarks.p: PDF Focus .Net is designed to help you in development of applications where is necessary to convert any PDF documents. Let's see what the component can do for you:

ul.li: Convert PDF to Word, DOCX, RTF with tables, images, full text formatting
Convert PDF to HTML with full text formatting, images, CSS
Convert PDF to Images: Jpeg, Png, Bmp, Tiff, Multipage-Tiff, System.Drawing.Image.
Get the number of pages in PDF and their sizes
Convert only a specific page or diapason of pages from a PDF document
Manipulate with PDF documents as files, streams, urls
Works in Medium Trust level and shared hosting
Requirements: from .NET Framework 4.0 to .NET 6.0 and higher.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.COCROptions.eOCRMode.Disabled
member.summary: Don't make OCR (optical recognizing) for images at all. The images will be placed into resulting document as is.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.COCROptions.eOCRMode.AllImages
member.summary: Perform the OCR (optical recognizing) for every image. Note, the component will consider the every image as textual data scanned or photographed and try to recognize it. In any case (successfully or failing) recognizing (OCR) the all images will NOT be placed in the resulting document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.COCROptions.eOCRMode.Auto
member.summary: Perform the OCR (optical recognizing) for images that looks as scanned or photographed text. Such images (after performing OCR) will be placed in the resulting document as text. Other images will be placed in the resulting document as images.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.COCROptions.OCRMethod
member.summary: Delegate to perform OCR (any 3rd party). We offer free libraries: Tesseract (https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract) or Nicomsoft (https://www.nicomsoft.com/nicomsoft-ocr-sdk-is-freeware-now).
member.param: An input image
member.returns: The result of OCR as PDF document. Note, your OCR library (for example, Nicomsoft or Tesseract) must the option to returns the OCR result as PDF documents.

member.summary: Method to perform OCR (any 3rd party). We offer free library from Nicomsoft: https://www.nicomsoft.com/nicomsoft-ocr-sdk-is-freeware-now.
member.remarks: Thus, you method has to accept an image and return the recognizing result in PDF format.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.COCROptions.Mode
member.summary: Set the OCR mode: Disable (default), All images, Automatic.
member.remarks:
Disabled - don't make OCR (optical recognizing) for images at all. The images will be placed into resulting document as is.
AllImages - Perform the OCR (optical recognizing) for every image. Note, the component will consider the every image as textual data scanned or photographed and try to recognize it. In any case (successfully or failing) recognizing (OCR) the all images will NOT be placed in the resulting document.
AllImages - Perform the OCR (optical recognizing) for images that looks as scanned or photographed text. Such images (after performing OCR) will be placed in the resulting document as text. Other images will be placed in the resulting document as images.

member.summary: The most useful and common type of Word document for editing. The resulting Word document looks as if it was typed by human.
member.remarks: The document layout created without using text boxes. This is very convenient for editing and a resulting Word document looks as typed by a human.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CWordOptions.eRenderMode.Continuous
member.summary: A golden mean between and modes.
member.remarks: The document layout created by using text boxes grouped in blocks.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CWordOptions.eRenderMode.Exact
member.summary: The most precise and fastest mode. The resulting Word document looks exact as PDF pixel by pixel.
member.remarks: The document layout created by using text boxes, this gives a monumental accuracy for PDF to Word conversion. Because all text in PDF documents builded by coordinates and using text boxes allows to build Word document in the same way.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value to show invisible text or not. Default value: false.
member.remarks:
Sometimes a PDF document can contain a picture with a scanned text. Besides of this, this document can contain invisible text over this picture.
In case you need to get only that text and skip picture, you may set 'PreserveImages' to false and set this property to true.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CWordOptions.KeepCharScaleAndSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to preserve the original char scaling and spacing or reset it to all symbols to 100%. Default value: true.
member.remarks:
As you may know PDF contains embedded fonts with own symbol widths. But the resulting Word document will have fonts installed at your system. Sometimes their have different symbol width.
true - scale width of symbols to make it the same as in PDF.
false - don't scale width of symbols and use width of installed fonts.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CHtmlOptions.eHtmlRenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering mode for the output HTML: Fixed or Flowing. Default value: .
member.remarks:
The HTML- is better to use for rendering, because it completely mirrors the PDF layout with structure of pages.
The HTML- is better for further processing: editing and combining. The markup of such documents has a flowing structure. It's much simple for understanding by a human. But the resulting HTML document may look not exactly the same as input PDF pixel by pixel.
Default value: .

member.remarks: The document layout created without using text boxes. This is very convenient for editing and a resulting HTML document looks as typed by a human.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CHtmlOptions.UseNumericCharacterReference
member.summary: In case of 'true': Write the all characters in "NCR" notation: &#xxx;. In case of 'false': Write the all characters as Unicode (recommended). Default value: false.
member.remarks:
A numeric character reference (NCR) is a common markup construct used in SGML and other SGML-related markup languages such as HTML and XML. It consists of a short sequence of characters that, in turn, represent a single character from the Universal Character Set (UCS) of Unicode.
See details in Wikipedia ...

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CHtmlOptions.ProduceOnlyHtmlBody
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to produce a complete HTML document or only between between <body>...</body> tags. Default value: false.
member.remarks:
In case of 'True' you will get only HTML between <body>...</body> tags.
This property will be useful to merge multiply HTML documents into a single.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.CopyrightText
member.summary: Gets and sets the text which will be placed on the each page at the top-left corner of the resulting document. For example, "Created by ....". Default value: String.Empty.
member.remarks:
You may specify any textual string, for example "Created by Simpson Family". And the each page of the resulting document will contains this text.
P.S. This property doesn't affect into XML and Excel conversion.
This property doesn't allow to format position, font size, family and so forth for the text. Because PDF Focus .Net is just a library to make conversion.
If you need the full control under the produced document or want modify it, you may try another our component Document .Net:
https://www.sautinsoft.com/products/document/.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.GetPageSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the page height and width in points for a specific page
member.remarks:
Point is the 1/72 of inch.
Let us say, you have a "Letter" page size 8,5 x 11 inches, you will get this size in points:
Width: 8,5 * 72 = 612 points.
Height: 11 * 72 = 792 points.
member.param: A specific page number in the PDF document
member.returns: Returns the structure with Width and Height properties.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.ToImage(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the specific page of the PDF document as image file.
member.param: Path to image file
Page which you want to save as image
member.remarks:
Before converting you may set various image properties using the property ImageOptions. For example, set:
Dpi - image resolution in dots per inch. Default value: 200
ImageFormat - format for produced images as standard . Default value: Png
ColorDepth - color depth or bit depth is the number of bits used to represent the color of a single pixel. Default value: 24 bit RGB
member.returns:
0 - saving successfully
2 - can't create output file, check the output path
3 - saving failed, email to support@sautinsoft.com

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.PreserveImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load images from PDF or skip them. Default value: true.
member.remarks:
In case of 'false' you may significantly save a time of loading a PDF document and using of memory.
we recommend to set this property to 'false' when you are need only in textual data from PDF.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.EmbeddedJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets and sets the value indicating Jpeg quality level for the images embedded in the output documents. Affects only to the images which embedded in Jpeg format. Default value: 90.

remarks.p: The amount of JPEG compression should really depend on the usage purpose for the JPEG, and the contents of the JPEG.
The quality level one should choose when exporting an image to JPEG is highly dependent upon the kind of detail contained within the image.

An image of a smooth blue sky or a sunset sky with large areas of orange gradient should probably use a high quality setting, 90-100. An image that contains nothing but complex detail could probably get away with a quality setting of 50-60, possibly even lower.There is no single "best" JPEG compression setting, and depending on the type and complexity of detail(or lack of complexity and detail), you may find yourself using 40-60, 70-80, or 90-100 as appropriate for the photo(s) you are exporting.

Here is a test with quality from left to right: 10, 20, 30, 40, 55, 70, 80, 90, 100%.
File sizes for the full files are: 210k, 278k, 347k, 477k, 601k, 709k, 987k, 1.7M, 7M.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfFocus.EmbeddedImagesFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the desired format to store images in the resulting document. Default value: eImageFormat.Auto.
member.remarks:
eImageFormat.Auto - In this case the images will be stored in their original format. In other words, the JPEG-images will be stored using Jpeg codec, the all others as PNG.
eImageFormat.Png - Force to convert all images into Png format.
eImageFormat.Jpeg - Force to convert all images into Jpeg format. Be careful: using Jpeg for images you can reduce the PDF size, but could lose the transparency.
Using this property together with the JpegQuality allows you to reduce to size of the output document.

member.name: T:Csv.CsvOptions
member.summary: Defines the options that can be passed to customize the reading or writing of csv files.
member.remarks: Do not reuse an instance of for multiple reads or writes.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.RowsToSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows to skip before reading the header row, defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.SkipRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a function to skip the current row based on its raw string value or 1-based index. Skips empty rows and rows starting with # by default.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Separator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use for separating data, defaults to '\0' which will auto-detect from the header row.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.TrimData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data should be trimmed when accessed, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Comparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparer to use when looking up header names.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.HeaderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets an indicator to the parser to expect a header row or not, defaults to .

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.ValidateColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a row should be validated immediately that the column count matches the header count, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.ReturnEmptyForMissingColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets whether an empty string is returned for a missing column, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Aliases
member.summary: Can be used to use multiple names for a single column. (e.g. to allow "CategoryName", "Category Name", "Category-Name")
member.remarks: A group with no matches is ignored.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowNewLineInEnclosedFieldValues
member.summary: Respects new line (either \r\n or \n) characters inside field values enclosed in double quotes, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowBackSlashToEscapeQuote
member.summary: Allows the sequence "\"" to be a valid quoted value (in addition to the standard """"), defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowSingleQuoteToEncloseFieldValues
member.summary: Allows the single-quote character to be used to enclose field values, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.NewLine
member.summary: The new line string to use when multiline field values are read, defaults to .
member.remarks: Requires to be set to true for this to have any effect.
